Package nl.uu.cs.aplib.exampleUsages.miniDungeon.testAgent

Class GoalLib

java.lang.Object
nl.uu.cs.aplib.exampleUsages.miniDungeon.testAgent.GoalLib
All Implemented Interfaces:
IInteractiveWorldGoalLib<Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile>>
public class GoalLib extends Object implements IInteractiveWorldGoalLib<Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile>>
Provide several basic goal-structures.

Keep in mind that the provided navigation and exploration tactics/goals currently has no ability to deal with items that block a corridor. The solution is for now to just generate another dungeon where we have no corridors are not blocked by items (use another random seed, for example). A better fix would be to have a smarter navigation and exploration. TO DO.

Author:
wish

  • Method Details

    • entityInCloseRange

      public GoalStructure entityInCloseRange​(String targetId)
      This will search the maze to guide the agent to a tile next to the specified entity ("touching" the entity).

      The goal's tactic can also handle some critical situations that may emerge during the search, e.g. if it is attacked by a monster, or when it gets low in the health.

      Specified by:
      entityInCloseRange in interface IInteractiveWorldGoalLib<Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile>>

    • grabPot

      GoalStructure grabPot​(TestAgent agent, Entity.EntityType potionType)
      A goal to send the agent to pick up a heal or rage pot nearby. It is a dynamic goal, as it will pick any such pot (rather than a specific one decided upfront).

    • checkIfEntityIsInCloseRange

      GoalStructure checkIfEntityIsInCloseRange​(String targetId)

    • smartEntityInCloseRange

      public GoalStructure smartEntityInCloseRange​(TestAgent agent, String targetId)
      A smarter version of entityInCloseRange(e) goal, that will also pick up a nearby potion along the way, if the bag is empty.

    • entityInteracted

      public GoalStructure entityInteracted​(String targetId)
      This goal causes the agent to interact with a given entity. It requires the agent to be standing next to the entity.
      Specified by:
      entityInteracted in interface IInteractiveWorldGoalLib<Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile>>

    • positionInCloseRange

      public GoalStructure positionInCloseRange​(Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile> p)
      Description copied from interface: IInteractiveWorldGoalLib
      The method constructs a goal structure G that will guide an agent towards a given location p. The goal is solved when the agent is in a position close enough to the given location p. What "close" means is left unspecified. The executing agent can fail/abort the goal if it no longer believe it is possible to reach p.
      Specified by:
      positionInCloseRange in interface IInteractiveWorldGoalLib<Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile>>

    • entityStateRefreshed

      public GoalStructure entityStateRefreshed​(String entityId)
      Description copied from interface: IInteractiveWorldGoalLib
      The method constructs a goal structure G that will guide an agent towards a world entity with the given id, until the entity becomes visible to the agent so that its knowledge on the entity state is refreshed. The goal is solved when the agent can see the entity. The executing agent can fail/abort the goal if it no longer believe it is possible to achieve the goal.
      Specified by:
      entityStateRefreshed in interface IInteractiveWorldGoalLib<Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile>>

    • exploring

      public GoalStructure exploring​(Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile> heuristicLocation, int budget)
      Description copied from interface: IInteractiveWorldGoalLib
      Construct a goal structure G that will make the agent explore the world. The exploration stops when either no further progress can be made, or when the given budget is exhausted. "Exploring" can be seen as a persistent goal (something that the agent should always strives to do). So, when it is terminated, it always terminate in a fail (this is intentional).

      If a heuristic location is given, the agent will try to explore towards this location.

      Specified by:
      exploring in interface IInteractiveWorldGoalLib<Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile>>

    • smartExploring

      public GoalStructure smartExploring​(TestAgent agent, Pair<Integer,​Sparse2DTiledSurface_NavGraph.Tile> heuristicLocation, int budget)
